heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 50.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.9°C) and outside temperature (up 2.7°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 780 m) and light levels (up 4286 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 914 m), and light levels (up 3289 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 779.7m lower than yesterday, 96.7m lower than the past week, 914.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 737m and a peak of 4780m, averaging 1614.1m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, a strong muggy feeling will dominate and very little to no wind will be present. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and a mix of sun and clouds. Weather could become unsettled.
